Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: lip glazed; below, black-figure decoration consisting of youth in short added white chiton with added red below waist riding horse with red mane to left with upright javelin beside him; to right, head with red hair and possibly right arm of beardless male looking to left; between the figures, nonsense inscription.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.32)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 395, no. B576)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0453) (Phase 1)
